pages.title: Nothing
pages.content:
ğŸ•Šï¸ 1. Jesus Fulfilled the Law Completely

ğŸ“– Matthew 5:17â€“18

â€œDo not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets; I have not come to abolish them but to fulfill them.
For truly I tell you, until heaven and earth disappear, not the smallest letter, not the least stroke of a pen, will by any means disappear from the Law until everything is accomplished.â€

â¡ Jesus didnâ€™t cancel the Law â€” He fulfilled every prophecy, requirement, and symbol. Once fulfilled, itâ€™s accomplished â€” no longer binding in the same way.

âœï¸ 2. The Law Was a Shadow, Christ Is the Reality

ğŸ“– Colossians 2:16â€“17

â€œTherefore do not let anyone judge you by what you eat or drink, or with regard to a religious festival, a New Moon celebration or a Sabbath day.
These are a shadow of the things that were to come; the reality, however, is found in Christ.â€

â¡ The Old Testament laws (like Sabbath or Passover) were shadows pointing to Jesus. Once the substance (Christ) came, the shadows no longer bind us.

âš–ï¸ 3. We Are Not Under the Law But Under Grace

ğŸ“– Romans 6:14

â€œFor sin shall no longer be your master, because you are not under the law, but under grace.â€

â¡ The law once defined sin and judgment, but in Christ we are under grace â€” a new covenant relationship, not legal obligation.

ğŸ“œ 4. Christ Ended the Lawâ€™s Rule Over Us

ğŸ“– Romans 10:4

â€œChrist is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.â€

â¡ The word â€œendâ€ (Greek: telos) means completion or goal. Christ brought the Lawâ€™s purpose to completion â€” righteousness now comes through faith, not by law-keeping.

ğŸ”¥ 5. The Law Was Our Guardian Only Until Christ Came

ğŸ“– Galatians 3:23â€“25

â€œBefore the coming of this faith, we were held in custody under the lawâ€¦
So the law was our guardian until Christ came that we might be justified by faith.
Now that this faith has come, we are no longer under a guardian.â€

â¡ The Law served a temporary purpose â€” to lead us to Christ. Once He came, that â€œguardianâ€ role ended.

ğŸ’” 6. Donâ€™t Return to the Old Law

ğŸ“– Galatians 5:1â€“4

â€œIt is for freedom that Christ has set us free. Stand firm, then, and do not let yourselves be burdened again by a yoke of slavery.
â€¦If you let yourselves be circumcised, Christ will be of no value to you at all.
You who are trying to be justified by the law have been alienated from Christ; you have fallen away from grace.â€

â¡ Anyone trying to keep the old laws as a requirement for salvation rejects Christâ€™s completed work.

ğŸŒ¿ 7. A New Covenant Replaced the Old

ğŸ“– Hebrews 8:13

â€œBy calling this covenant â€˜new,â€™ He has made the first one obsolete; and what is obsolete and outdated will soon disappear.â€

â¡ The Mosaic Covenant (with all its laws) was replaced by the New Covenant through Jesusâ€™ blood.

ğŸ©¸ 8. The Law Could Never Perfect, Only Jesus Could

ğŸ“– Hebrews 10:1

â€œThe law is only a shadow of the good things that are comingâ€”not the realities themselves.
It can never, by the same sacrifices repeated endlessly year after year, make perfect those who draw near to worship.â€

â¡ The Lawâ€™s rituals could never save â€” Jesusâ€™ sacrifice did, once and for all.

ğŸ”“ 9. Freedom in Christ, Not Bondage to the Law

ğŸ“– Galatians 5:13

â€œYou, my brothers and sisters, were called to be free. But do not use your freedom to indulge the flesh; rather, serve one another humbly in love.â€

â¡ Our freedom is not license to sin â€” itâ€™s freedom from legal bondage, to now walk in the Spirit and love.

pages.title: You
pages.content:
âœ… Quick Summary (Copy-Friendly)

Left Pane Functionalities:

Create

  • Create page

  • Create folder

  • Insert at the correct hierarchy

  • Auto-select new item

  • Dropdown menu: "New Page / New Folder"

Folder

  • Add folder

  • Expand/collapse

  • Rename

  • Delete

  • Drag & drop support

  • Contains nested pages/folders

Page

  • Add page

  • Rename

  • Delete

  • Open & edit

  • Drag & drop to reorder or move

  • Auto-highlight active page

Move

  • Drag & drop pages/folders

  • Move inside folders or to root

  • Instant tree refresh

  • Visual drop feedback

  • Persist updated structure

If you want, I can also prepare:

ğŸ“Œ UI layout for these features
ğŸ“Œ React component architecture for the left pane
ğŸ“Œ Drag & drop logic using React DnD or DndKit
ğŸ“Œ Database schema for pages/folders

pages.content: Who are you to say this
